page.title: 07FARMING IN TILSTON
page.content: In this{dairy farming region}there are {10 farms}in the block. Bank Farm is a mixed farm of 200 acres producing 859 litres milk daily with 60 cows and 70 followers. They are also agricultural contractors. Since milk quotas were introduced to the dairy industry in 1984 farmers have had to reduce output by{9%}causing financial hardship as production costs rise and income is reduced. Some dairy farmers are selling up, others turning to other types of farming. Windmill Farm carries 280{intensively {reared beef cattle}mainly Friesian bulls. The farm also has a flock of 120{breeding ewes. Prices in 1985 {are:-}calves (2wk) Â£120 cattle (440Kg) Â£1.05 per Kg, lambs (16 -18Kg) Â£2.30Kg.{Land prices}are falling as more farms are sold. Price in May 1985 is around Â£1670 per acre.
